Micki WagnerShopping Writer

I cover everything kitchen-related, from cookware and countertop appliances to pantry staples and cleaning and organizing must-haves. I’m based in New York, NY.

published about 5 hours ago

We independently select these products—if you buy from one of our links, we may earn a commission. All prices were accurate at the time of publishing.

I’ve tested nearly 10 different coffee makers and espresso machines over the past few years. As sleek as they might look and as nicely as they might brew a shot, they end up not getting a very long stay on my counter. I don’t drink espresso every day, so any espresso machine would be in addition to my beloved Keurig. 

Frankly, my limited counter space just gets too tight with both. Usually, that means the too-large espresso machine gets boxed up and sent to a friend or family member who has more counter space than I do.

I like the idea of having both, though. Espresso machines are a fun-to-have appliance that I enjoy taking the time to use on weekends. Thankfully, Cuisinart’s new Espresso Bar Slim Espresso Machine is the answer to my cramped counter conundrum.

What’s So Great About the Cuisinart Espresso Bar Slim Espresso Machine?

This appliance solves the biggest (pun intended) problem I’ve had with espresso machines: the bulkiness. It takes up the same amount of space as two coffee syrup bottles (well, the ones from my favorite brand) and weighs just under 13 pounds. At this size, I can fit both my Keurig K-Elite and this Cuisinart espresso machine right next to each other on my counter, along with those syrup bottles and a Mason jar filled with ground espresso beans.

This espresso machine is $100 less than the compact versions I was eyeing from other big-name brands. Like those machines, this one also comes with a frothing wand, so I can steam hot milk for lattes. There’s a stainless steel jug and a cleaning pin to go with that frothing wand, as well as a two-in-one coffee scoop and tamper. Plus there are  interchangeable single- and double-shot filters for the portafilter.

It also has an easy-to-use interface that allows me to choose my drink of the moment — whether I want a single or double shot of espresso, and even if I want to brew them cold, which is perfect for my daily iced coffees.

My Honest Review of the Cuisinart Espresso Bar Slim Espresso Machine?

Beyond its perfect size for my countertop, what I like the most about this machine is its ability to do a cold extraction. The Cuisinart brews the espresso cold instead of hot, so it won’t melt the ice in my glass and water down my drink. I drink iced coffee all year round, so this is exactly what I need. Plus, this machine makes bold, full-bodied shots of espresso on par with ones from my favorite coffee shops. 

I will say the cold extraction function does take a little bit of time — it clocked in at just over four minutes to brew my cold espresso. I usually make my coffee while I’m cooking breakfast, though. So, I will set up my machine to brew first, go make my scrambled eggs in my new favorite pans, and by the time I’m done cooking, my coffee is ready for me. 

This espresso machine is something I use primarily on the weekends or when I’m working from home, I’m not in a hurry when I’m using it. In fact, I love the cold extraction element so much, it’s become my go-to machine for homemade iced coffees. 

What’s your favorite way to make espresso? Tell us about it in the comments below.
